sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Review MEX:

li ci pi'i vo du li ? = ?

(Answer: 12)

Review Material (5-7 min)

Place Structure Fundamentals

Every gismu has defined places:

klama: x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 using x5

Filling Places

mi klama lo zarci lo zdani lo dargu lo karce

I go to the store from home via the road using a car.

Conversion (se/te/ve/xe)

Conversion Effect
se Swap x1 and x2
te Swap x1 and x3
ve Swap x1 and x4
xe Swap x1 and x5 
mi se prami la .alis.

I am loved by Alice. (I become x2)

Place Tags (fa/fe/fi/fo/fu)

mi dunda fe lo plise fi do

I give apples to you. (Explicit place markers)

zo'e — Unspecified

mi klama lo zarci zo'e zo'e lo karce

I go to the store (from somewhere, via somewhere) using a car.

Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Fill All Places

For dunda (x1 gives x2 to x3):

  1. I give a book to Alice.
  2. Alice gives an apple to me.
  3. Bob gives money to Alice.
Answers
  1. mi dunda lo cukta la .alis.
  2. la .alis. cu dunda lo plise mi
  3. la .bob. cu dunda lo jdini la .alis.

Exercise 2: Use Conversion

Convert these sentences:

  1. "I am taught by Alice" (se ctuca)
  2. "The book is read by me" (se tcidu)
  3. "I am given an apple" (se dunda)
Answers
  1. mi se ctuca la .alis.
  2. lo cukta cu se tcidu mi
  3. mi se dunda lo plise

Exercise 3: Complex Places

Translate using full place structure:

  1. I go to Paris from London via train.
  2. Alice teaches math to Bob using books.
Answers
  1. mi klama la .paris. la .london. zo'e lo trene
  2. la .alis. cu ctuca la .cmaci. la .bob. lo cukta

items.text: I give a book to Alice.
Alice gives an apple to me.
"The book is read by me" (se tcidu)
I go to Paris from London via train.
items.answer: `mi klama la .paris. la .london. zo'e lo trene`

sections.content:
Challenge (1-2 min)

Place Structure Sprint:

Choose 5 gismu and fill all their places with meaningful sumti.

Example:

vecnu: mi vecnu lo cukta la .alis. li mu

(I sell a book to Alice for 5.)

Summary

You reviewed place structure, conversion, and place tags — the foundation of Lojban grammar.

Tomorrow preview: Tanru and lujvo challenge.
